Key Arguments: The government or a body set up by them lacks the ability and intention to determine what is genuinely true.
Granting a department the power to decide truth and censor dissenting views is a threat to democracy.
Governments and departments have a poor track record of correcting their mistakes.
The proposal resembles a 'ministry of truth' which is not equipped to make such judgments.
Restricting free speech does not promote truth.
Notable Quotes: To give a department the power to decide what is truth and to censor what they don't like is a threat to democracy.
This is inviting the 'ministry of truth' to make a judgement which they are not equipped to do.
